title.narrative: Support to the organization of the African Union Summit on Industrialization and Economic Diversification within the framework of IDDA III

description.narrative: The Third Industrial Development Decade for Africa (IDDA III) (2016-2025) that was passed by the United Nations General Assembly (UN GA) in July 2016 through Resolution A/70/L.49/Rev.1, represents one of the most important and latest undertaking and initiative endorsed by the global community in favor of Africa#s industrialization. In passing the IDDA III resolution, the UNGA designated UNIDO as the lead agency for its implementation. UNIDO was specifically requested to lead the development and implementation of a programme framework for IDDA III; upscale its technical assistance to African countries; foster partnerships with various stakeholders and other relevant entities in the UN; and mobilize resources for the implementation of IDDA III. As an immediate outcome of the implementation of the Joint IDDA III Roadmap, In February 2020, the 33rd Ordinary Session of the AU Heads of State and Government Assembly held from 9-10 February 2020 through Assembly Decision AU/Dec.751 (XXXIII), requested the AUC in collaboration with UNIDO, UNECA and the Afro-Champions, to organize a Summit on Africa#s Industrialization and Economic Diversification during the Africa Industrialization Week.
